reviews.author: Legna
reviews.comment_content: The content is a upgraded version of HKDSE chemistry. It is basic but more detailed.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof are nice but i didnt attend many class so i cant tell much about them
reviews.comment_grading:
Chem 1004   Overall A-
Quiz 1(5%) 45/45  mean:34.5
Quiz 2(5%) 48/50 mean: 39.8
Video Group Project(35%) 31/35 mean: 30.7
Final Exam(55%) 69.5/100 mean: 53.8

There are some students who have studied chemistry in their secondary schools so it is uneasy to compete with them.
But the overall grading is quite good .
As both quiz are open book, it is easy to get high marks. I would say the project is very important if you wish to get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
The general workload is adequate.
Hard work will pay off in the end.

reviews.author: hipster
reviews.title: A mixture of simple chemistry and complex concepts
reviews.comment_content:
The content is doable. Coming from IB, I didnt do chemistry and i realised there are some contents related to IB and IGCSE. There are IB Chemistry HL topics as well so dont think this is the easily chemistry so it must be easy. As a person from basic chemsitry background the content is not hard as long as you understand the concepts and math. mole calcualtions are not hard ifyou do 3-4 quesetions and understand how they work.
The battery topic is a little hard so make sure you understand how those calculation work with redox reactions because they will be in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
due to the weather, some classes were cancelled and the last lesson was fully just read through but not taught.
Most lectures are just reading through the lecture notes so you can basically read it through yourself but you must be self disciplined to do so.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is okay.
I didnt do so well in the exam with a little bit higher than mean.
Also, PLEASE GO CHECK YOUR PAPERS! I got 3 marks from checking. B+ --> A-
67/100 Final Exam
45/45 quiz 1
43/50 quiz 2
31.5 / 35 Group Project
Final Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is minimal.
IT is honestly very easy course. Just memorise the the chemcial equations and organic chemistry and do the calculation questions. Practice!

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: An OK introductory course to chemistry
reviews.comment_content:
I did not study chemistry in HKDSE but I heard that the contents are similar. So if you studied HKDSE chemistry before this course would be easy for you. There are a total of 6 chapters in the course. Each with a large number of contents that require recitation. Therefore, I would suggest those who enroll in this course revise every day otherwise there is no way for you to recite everything at the last minute.

From an academic perspective, the course provides some basic knowledge of chemistry, which is kind of useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The two instructors carry some real-time experiments during lessons, which adds a lot of fun to the lecture. However, both of them teach very quickly. So if you miss one lecture or go for a toilet break, you will be confused very easily. Notes are provided and everything in the quizzes and final exam will be covered in the notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The overall grading of this course is not good, but not bad as well. It mainly depends on how you do the project.

Quizzes: 10% ( has 2 quizzes, open book, done online)
Project: 35% ( You can choose group experimental project, group video project, or individual project)
Final exam: 55% (close book, done in sports hall)

My grade:
Quiz 1: 36/45 (Mean:34.5)
Quiz 2: 49/50 (Mean:39.8)
Project ( Group video project): 31/35 (Mean:30.7)
Final: 69/100 (Mean:53.8)
Overall grade: A-

Note: The most important thing here is to find good teammates that can carry you in the group project so that even if you perform poorly in the final exam you won't be sad after they release the grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is very light. If you can understand the notes by yourself, you don't even need to join the lessons. There are no midterms or homework. If you choose the group project, the workload can be shared among teammates, which can reduce your workload as well.

reviews.author: ycaiba
reviews.title: Really relaxing experience if you have learned chemistry in high school
reviews.comment_content:
Course objectives are as follows:
1. Introduce the basic concepts of Chemistry.
2. Connect Chemistry with everyday life and modern technology.
3. Explain the importance of Chemistry in the environment, medicine, and daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jason is really interesting and humorous. He is always glad to answer other's problems. Unfortunately, we planned to hold some interesting chemistry demonstration
experiments after the resumption of on-campus classes but we failed to do so.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final 49/50%
Quiz 10/10%
Project 36/40%
Overall A+
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly no workload. The midterm examination is replaced by a project report. That report is individual so no need to worry about teammates. The final exam is open-book. Just remember the structure of this lesson and search for what you need from the notes.

reviews.author: Yayx14
reviews.title: Not bad grade course but not good either
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
Chapter 2: The Air.
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life.
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry.
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels.
Same as before.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 %from the Online Quizzes
40 %from the Study Project
50 %from the Final Examination
online quizzes: (idk the mean)
quiz 1: 41/46
quiz 2: 41/50
Study Project: 26/40 (mean is 26 or 26.5)
Final: 74.67 (mean is 72.7 with sd 17)

2 quizzes, 1 project, 1 final
for the project, you have many time to finish it.

reviews.author: Lhtinky
reviews.comment_content: I don't think it is a foundation course for students who didn't learn chem at all!!!! I think they want you to understand the content which taught in dse but they need you to understand just in few months. One of my friends who studied Chem in dse said the content is fine but the exam was very hard
reviews.comment_teaching: Jason is good. He tried to let us feel fun in the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: BAD
reviews.comment_workload: heavy!the content which taught in dse but they need you to understand just in few months.

reviews.author: Code Forgetter
reviews.comment_content: Basics of chemistry if you've learned it in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear
reviews.comment_grading:
5%*2 online quizzes and you have 1 day to take the quiz
30% Project (group or individual)
60% Final

I got 1.5sd higher in final, above mean in quizzes and project.
Overall 84.48, and I got A-. So I don't think it's a very good grade course, just fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload, remember to do the quiz of each chapter and study the notes. The exam is similar to a high school exam with multiple choices and short answer questions.

reviews.author: Balloon
reviews.title: GOOD CC CHOICE
reviews.comment_content:
the scope of this course is VERY wide lol although this sem he skipped chapter 6 since he didn't have enough time to cover.
At the beginning, the content seems alright, but when it got to the electrolysis and batteries, things start to get difficult.....

Using Dr. Chan's words, then this covers covered the whole DSE 3 years chem materials...

no chem background might need to put in a bit more effort.
reviews.comment_teaching:
he has the passion to teach chemistry, many story sharing and videos of him on TVB shown in class time ( prob the only time i actually paid attention in class lol) and also experiments in the class were also super fun!

During the second half of this sem, he seemed a bit tired(not sure was it becoz he caught a cold or sth).

for this sem, he didn't show up for 3 lectures.... with no prior announcements...
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quiz #1:
Mean: 38.2 out of 46
Online Quiz # 2:
Mean: 28.7 out of 35

Individual Project:
Mean 21.9 out of 30
(can score high if have enough chem content, and originality)

Final Exam(so many people left early):
Mean: 54.2 /100
(study is needed if don't have much chem bg and want to score high)
reviews.comment_workload:
2 online quizzes
1 report(individual or grp)
1 final

(lots of memorization/understanding needed for the final exam, especially the MCQs..)
final: 40 MCQs(40points), and 3 case studies(60 points)
for the MCQs (if you know, then you know, if you don't then you don't. Make sure you go thru all materials. He will provide some important sections to pay extra attention during the tutorial before final exam [will provide tutorial video])
case studies: can utilize pass paper and chapter practice questions ( practise q are much harder)

reviews.author: eltonmiao
reviews.title: Good grade with appropriate effort
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into six Chapters:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
History of atom and simple calculations such as molar mass, number of atoms etc. (Very easy)
Chapter 2: The Air. (Easy)
Electron distribution, covalent bond, molecular compound, intermolecular force, electronegativity
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Acid and base, reactions reacted to air pollution and global warming, ozone and sunscreen. (Fine)
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life.
Metallic bond, alloys, ionic bond, salts, reactions related with oxygen, water and acid. (Memorisation is needed)
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry.
All about redox reaction. Including the working principal of rechargeable battery. (This chapter should be the hardest to grasp)
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels.

Overall, the content is appropriate for those without any chemistry background. However, keep in mind that in this semester, only chapter 1-6 were taught.
Lecture video, PowerPoint, lecture notes provided. There is homework for each chapter but not graded.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Jason Chan didnâ€™t attend few lecture throughout the whole semester WITHOUT noticing us in advance. Therefore, chapter 6 was not taught and not examined.However, his teaching is good and there is in depth explanation of each homework. He uploads the homework tutorial lecture to YouTube. All lecture videos are also provided and released at the END of each chapter.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 % from the Online Quizzes
30 % from the Study Project
60 % from the Final Examination

Online Quiz 1: 37.5/46 Mean: 38.2 Max: 46
Online Quiz 2: 35/35  Mean: 28.7 Max: 35
Individual Project: 29.5/30  Mean: 21.9 Max: 29.5 ( I chose individual project instead of group project as I feel that you actually spend less time by doing the whole thing by your own and it truly reflects ur effort. Prepare at least 2 whole days for the individual project to get above mean results)
Final Exam: 75/100 Mean: 54.2 s.d. ~ 18.5 Max 89.5

Personally I donâ€™t have any chemistry background except chemistry lessons in F.3. I am not those people who dropped chemistry in their secondary school.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is appropriate. Before the final exam, he arranged a final tutorial lesson to remind us some of the important points (what need to be memorised). He also uploaded the recording online. Overall appropriate workload except before the deadline of project and right before final exam. To help yourself understand better, it is a good idea to search for tutorials using YouTube. Remember to go through the lecture notes for at least two times. Attending the lessons can certainly help you remember all the concept easier but I feel like it is fine to go through it by myself.

reviews.title: Really funny and practical course!
reviews.comment_content:
Really funny and practical!  Every lesson starts with several interesting and eye-catching experiments(The one we did on Halloween is really epic XD)
And the contents are the fundamentals of chemistry, fully combined to our daily life, in which Dr.Fire taught in a designed way. This course is never tedious.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Fire is really young and charming. His teaching style is also well-designed. You can tell his effort in preparing for his course!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading consists of 3 parts: project(30%) and final exam(60%), 2 quiz(5%each)
I got a mean in project and 90 in final, finally got an A.
Hard to get an A+, but if you have learnt CHEM before, A range should be easy for you.
reviews.comment_workload: low and interesting.

reviews.author: Jaharper
reviews.comment_content: Quite simple if you have done chemistry before but I think you will struggle if you have not so consider that if you are thinking of taking this course
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good teaching quality but you have to like chemistry a little bit if you want to be interested
reviews.comment_grading: Should be able to pass really, maybe you will need a good chemistry back ground if you are going to do very well in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty fair, just work hard, and you will be rewarded with a decent grade.

reviews.author: Diana Jeong
reviews.comment_content: The most fundamental things about Chemistry. You don't really need much background for this course. There is not much calculation as well, so you might find it boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very engaging. He prepares a lot of experiments for fun. But I think he read the ppt most of the time, which wasn't very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was pretty good. There are true and false questions and questions based on your understanding.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no midterm. And you can choose to do the project as a group or individually.

reviews.author: Zori
reviews.title: A considerable course for JEE science student
reviews.comment_content:
The basic knowledge about chemistry, it covers almost all the fields mentioned in the chemistry textbook from mainland secondary school, including elements, electronic reaction, chemical equation and so on. It will be easy for JEE student from the science track, but for an ordinary student without relevant background, the content is indeed challenging honestly speaking. Students do understand the fundamental knowledge of chemistry after the course.
Special attention should be paid by JEE students that the syllabus may be different from the one they learned from secondary school, so there is a risk when answering the questions in this course merely based on the knowledge one learned before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is a really passionate and patient instructor. His teaching in class is very clear with a comfortable accent. It will be also very easy to reach out to him after class if students encounter any problems.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme consists of an individual project, a final exam, and several online quizzes. It is believed that there is a wide range of A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very high for JEE student with the relevant background as long as students arrange their time wisely for the group project. However, the workload will be pretty high for students without those backgrounds.
